[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_pop] [PoP expiration] Are PoPs time-limited or can old PoPs be reused indefinitely, allowing validators to recycle keys across epochs without proper PoP regeneration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Multiple validators same key] Can multiple validators register with the same public key, and if aggregation assumes unique keys, does this enable signature forgery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Validator key derivation] If validators derive keys from common seed material, could key collision or predictability enable one validator to impersonate another? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Expensive subgroup checks] Can an attacker force validators to perform expensive subgroup_check() operations repeatedly, degrading consensus performance and potentially causing liveness failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Verification DoS] Can an attacker flood validators with invalid signatures that require expensive pairing operations to verify, degrading consensus performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_pop] [PoP verification DoS] Can an attacker submit many validator registrations with invalid PoPs, forcing expensive verification operations and DoS of validator onboarding? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Large aggregate signatures] Can an attacker create extremely large aggregate signatures by including many signature shares, causing memory exhaustion during aggregation or verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Private key memory exposure] Does PrivateKey properly zero sensitive memory on drop, or could private key material remain in memory accessible to attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Timing side-channel in signing] Is PrivateKey::sign() constant-time with respect to the private key, or could timing analysis leak key bits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Timing side-channel in verification] Does signature verification timing vary based on signature validity, enabling timing attacks to probe for valid signatures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Cache timing attacks] Can cache timing side-channels during public key operations leak information about validator identities or keys? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [BLS IETF standard] [Non-compliance attack] Does the implementation fully comply with the BLS IETF draft standard, or could deviations enable cross-implementation attacks when interoperating with standard-compliant systems? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [BLS variant] [Minimal-pubkey-size variant] Is the 'Minimal-pubkey-size' variant (G1 pubkeys, G2 signatures) implemented correctly, or could assumptions about G1/G2 ordering enable verification bypass? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_pop] [PoP standard compliance] Does ProofOfPossession follow the RY07 PoP scheme correctly, or could implementation deviations enable rogue-key attacks despite PoP checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Hash-to-curve standard] [SSWU map] Does the implementation use the correct SSWU (Simplified SWU) mapping for hash-to-curve, or could incorrect mapping enable finding preimages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_validatable] [Validation race condition] In Validatable<PublicKey>, if validate() caches results in a OnceCell, can concurrent validation attempts cause race conditions where unvalidated keys are temporarily used? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Concurrent aggregation] If PublicKey::aggregate() is called concurrently with the same keys, can race conditions in the underlying blst library cause incorrect aggregate keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Concurrent signature operations] Can concurrent Signature::aggregate() calls on overlapping signature sets cause data races or produce inconsistent results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_pop] [PoP verification race] If multiple threads verify the same PoP concurrently, can race conditions in verification state cause one thread to bypass checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Scalar arithmetic overflow] In key operations, can scalar arithmetic overflow or wrap around, causing validators to compute incorrect public keys or signatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Point addition overflow] Can point addition during signature aggregation overflow or produce incorrect results, enabling forgery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Division by zero] In any cryptographic operations, can division by zero occur (e.g., with zero-valued scalars), causing panics that disrupt consensus? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Silent error handling] If PublicKey::aggregate() fails silently or returns a default value instead of an error, can this enable use of invalid aggregate keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Verification error masking] Does Signature::verify() return detailed error information, or could generic errors mask underlying issues like subgroup check failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_pop] [PoP error handling] If ProofOfPossession::verify() fails, are the error cases distinguishable to prevent side-channel information leakage about key validity? (Low)
